column1: Table 26.  Hawaii - Race and Hispanic Origin:  1900 to 1990
(See text for sources, definitions, and explanations)  Two tables on this pages. Both tables have row headers in column A, the column headers are in rows 3 to 5 and 30 to 31.
(NA) Not available.  1/Hispanic origin based on Spanish language.

1/Data for 1910 to 1940 include one or more Pacific islands that were enumerated with Hawaii and for which data by race were not
    published separately.  The total population of Hawaii (excluding outlying islands) was 191,874 in 1910, 255,881 in 1920, 368,000 in 1930,
    and 422,770 in 1940.
2/Puerto Rican classified as White from 1910 to 1930 and as a separate race in 1940 and 1950.
